metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000132 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mercurial version 4.5 and earlier contains a Incorrect Access Control (CWE-285) vulnerability in Protocol server that can result in Unauthorized data access. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 4.5.1. It was discovered that Mercurial incorrectly handled access control. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
mercurial-common - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4').
